label.phrase: the lwu inquiry is an issue local councils feel strongly about and i'm looking forward to participating in minister rees discussion

i hope the people of edinburgh will be reassured that their council is responding to the obvious difficulties many of them face in finding a home
councils are at financial breaking point and are struggling to provide the services and facilities their ratepayers need and deserve
councils are committed to their communities and are good at providing for them but are fighting with one hand tied behind their backs
there remains a critical need to take a time out while the council reviews the rules governing these controversial developments
over the next few weeks council will be analysing and planning the what the why and areas for future improvements
we are close but we are not there yet but the council wants to do this so we will see where it goes
it has not progressed much further than the council meeting
the issue is still with council we appreciate the situation but have to address all needs

as far as i can tell nothing else needs to be done we're waiting on the construction certificate which hopefully council will get to this week
